data.title: News & Events
data.meta_description: Details of Epiphany's diary including our creative classical concerts and innovative improvisation events and Sound Portraits with booking and other information
data.text:
Epiphany are involved in an ECO/Arts event at Poynton Methodist Church. We will be performing 'in the round' and the programme will be a mix of improvised and classical music - with songs from Linda Entwistle's 'Requiem for the Earth'. There will be two performances at 4.30pm and 7.30pm. Entry for a donation.

Epiphany will be in Clayton (Bradford) working with Turning Point - an organisation who care for adults with learning difficulties. We will be joined by artist, Tamara Jackson.

Join Epiphany for another Sunday Evening Coffee Concert. at Poynton Methodist Church starting at 7.30pm (doors open at 7pm for coffee/tea/cake). Programme includes Beethoven String Quartet op 59 no 1. Entry for a donation.

Epiphany will be working with Ukrainian refugees in Bexhill, playing for visitors to the 'Orangery' tearooms at Ashburnham Place and working with some of the volunteers and staff at Ashburnham Place.

Epiphany will be offering 'mobile' Sound Portraits throughout the Compton Verney Gallery on 29th November in the evening. More details will appear here nearer the time

More info

Join Epiphany for their annual 'Classics at Christmas' concert at St George's Church in Poynton starting at 7.30pm. Booking opens in October. More details will appear here nearer the time.

Epiphany enjoyed playing Sound Portraits and putting on a 'The Space' event, in Shepton Mallett and Chesterblade Hills in Somerset.

Read More

Epiphany enjoyed performing an evening of light classics as part of Poynton Arts Festival.

Read More
